intro: Delissea grimesiana var. lydgatei, commonly known as the Lydgate's delissea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, commonly known as the heath family, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in shaded forest environments, often found in areas with high humidity and cool temperatures. Its flowers are usually small, bell-shaped, and range in color from white to pale pink, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts to protect its natural habitat.
